title: unesco_heritage_Historic_Areas_of_Istanbul
text:
Name: Historic Areas of Istanbul. short_description:

With its strategic location on the Bosphorus peninsula between the Balkans and Anatolia, the Black Sea and the Mediterranean, Istanbul has been associated with major political, religious and artistic events for more than 2,000 years. Its masterpieces include the ancient Hippodrome of Constantine, the 6th-century Hagia Sophia and the 16th-century SÃ¼leymaniye Mosque, all now under threat from population pressure, industrial pollution and uncontrolled urbanization.
